DarkHawk:

"Well well well"Said mockly the Predacon while he aimed with his=
 blaster "you are quite stupid or Brave to came to hydra's lair, unarmed an=
d alone it seems... It's a pity that you wont get out here alive"

After sa=
id that Darkhaw shoot a paralizing gun agains Tucson



From: Sandy 
Sent: =
Monday, February 15, 2010 10:12 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re:=
 Recovering Rodimus/BlackFortress


  
Tucson had to think and move quickly=
 which was not very easy for him due to his injury. Still, in the same vici=
nity as Scourge, Cyclonus and Rodimus, he manages to keep himself out of si=
ght, using the skills which had been taught to him by Prowl. Quietly he sta=
nds up against a wall in a dark crevace of the room, making no sound. He th=
inks for just a moment at how cowardice this must seem. To try and make a m=
ove and then recede into darkness like a spinless glitch. That he was not. =
He could feel the hold Cyclonus had over Rodimus and it enrages him to the =
point where he grips his fists in anger. He thinks to himself.

" I've come=
 this far, I just can't give up and turn the other way. Rodimus, whether he=
 knows it or not, needs my help. But how to go about this? This is somethin=
g Kup nor Prowl trained me to do."

He puts his hand on his chest. His acti=
ons were of his spark, not of his mind. His spark was telling him to contin=
ue on and not give up. 
He remembers the good days when Rodimus was very cl=
ose to all his Autobot comrades, and how many battles were won thanks to hi=
m and his guidence. And now, it appeared that Rodimus was the one who neede=
d to be rescued. He closes his eyes in thought.

" Optimus Prime, what woul=
d you have done if you were in my position? If there were a time when I nee=
ded your guidence, it's now. Rodimus needs me but how? How can I pull this =
off? I'm just one Autobot with only his bare spark leading him..." 

In tho=
ught he tries to go back to a time, when he had met Optimus Prime as a youn=
g rookie in training. He flashes back to one particular moment when he actu=
ally got the opportunity to talk to the great Autobot leader. He remembers =
how he was told that no matter how dim a situation was, there was always a =
light to guide them through. It comes to him, the very verse Rodimus had sa=
id when he first took up the Matrix of Leadership.

"Light our Darkest Hour=
." He thinks to himself at first.

"That's it. That's what Optimus Prime wo=
uld have done. But instead of the Matrix it's up to ME to light our darkest=
 hour. Of course, I awoke first, it must mean something. All right, Tucson =
get off your sorry aft and make this happen."

He gathers the strength to w=
alk into where he could be seen, judging by the heat that lights were givin=
g off, as faint as the lights may be. He stands before Cyclonus, and Scourg=
e unarmed, yet ready to defend himself if need be.

" Yes, you do have some=
one here. And that someone is me. I don't know if you remember me or not, w=
e may not have even met. My name is Tucson and I'm proud to say that I am a=
 member of the Autobot faction." 

He then senses Rodimus not too far away.=


" All right, Rodimus, I have a question for you, and you may answer at wi=
ll. What was the very verse that brought the Matrix of Leadership to life, =
thus giving you the power of its spark? I know you know this, and right now=
 you may be hating my sorry servos, but I think I could use a refresher on =
what it was. Can you tell me?"

He was now preparing himself to get the bol=
ts beaten out of him. This would either make or break things. It was a heck=
 of a gamble yet Tucson knew it was his greatest Trump Card and he was not =
afraid to use it. 

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Super Cyclonus <supercyc=
lonus@...> wrote:
>
> As Hydras' extended his invitation to Cyclonus, and S=
courge, Rodimus was surprised for a moment, but then just leaned back again=
st a support beam, his arms once again folded across his chest. He was abou=
t to say some thing really clever about this when he thought he heard somet=
hing . . . 
> 
> >"Rodimus."
> 
> Dark Rodimus jerked up. He was not sure w=
hat he heard, but it sounded like some sort of ghostly whisper of his name.=
 He glanced around . . . 
> 
> "What was that?!" Scourge said, instantly on=
 the alert, his hyper keen senses also keying in on the strange whisper. He=
 whipped his disintergration rifle out and began to look around, his optics=
 narrow and watchful. 
> 
> "What was what?" Cyclonus said, obviously unawa=
re of the whisper, but he too grew more watchful, trusting Scourge's senses=
. 
> 
> >"This is Perceptor, We may have a posible intruder..." The Sgurity=

> > Drones are released to start a search party"
> 
> "An intruder" Scourg=
e almost hissed as he began to move around the room, his weapon was once ag=
ain drawn and ready. 
> 
> Rodimus, his quarrel with Cyclonus and Scourge a=
ll but forgotten as this new situation developed had already drawn his weap=
on as well. There would be time enough for thier fight once this was over. =

> 
> "What is it?" Rodimus said, his voice tense but ready.
> 
> Scourge g=
runted, "I had it. It smelled like an Autobot" Scourge continued to prowl a=
round the room, his optics glowing as he probed different areas.
> 
> "Ahhh=
h . . ." Scourge squated down to run two fingers on the ground and hold it =
to his nose, " . . . But he was here." Scourge chuckled darkly. "And we sha=
ll find him, yes we shall, we have prey." 
> 
> > Hydras when he heard his =
security chief warning said "Every one take 
> > a search PArty and seek ev=
ery inch of this base"
> 
> Cyclonus nodded as he watched, "Hydras, I shall=
 help coordinate the seaerh from here."
> 
> Dark Rodimus glanced back at H=
ydras and then at Scourge and Cyclonus, "And I'm going to catch that intrud=
er!" His voice all business now. "Whatever it is we're going to catch it, a=
nd dismantle it . . ." Rodimus energized his weapon, " . . . The HARD way!"=

> 
> Scourge stood up saying nothing, looking off in the direction that hi=
s powerful tracking sensors told him were small droplets of lubricant, and =
his quarry. With smooth and whisper silent strides he took off at a jog, fo=
llowed quickly and somewhat more loudly by Rodimus!
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston=

> (Cyclonus/Scourge/Rodimus)
>
